flawed_nl_solution:
From the 200 cookies, Javier's wife ate 3/10*200 = <<3/10*200=60>>60
After the wife ate 60 cookies, the number of cookies that remained was 200-60 = <<200-60=410>>410
The daughter also ate 40 cookies leaving 410-40 = <<410-40=370>>370 cookies.
If Javier ate half of the remaining cookies, he ate 1/2*370 = 185.
The number of cookies that remained is 370-185 = <<370-185=185>>185

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 140, not 410. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
